Hints: For help, see tutorial in DataVizForAll.org      ------>
Show title at top of Polygon legend (or leave blank)
Show a title for the Polygon GeoJSON file
Polygon file pathname in your GitHub repo, or external web address (or blank if no polygon data)
When a polygon is clicked, display "img" property in geoJSON, if available.

Setting: Display Polygon Labels at Zoom Level
Hints: Show a polygon property label at zoom levels listed below (or leave blank for none)
Polygon property label will appear at this zoom level and above
For help, see tutorial in DataVizForAll.org      ------>

Customize: pop-density-2015, Density per square mile; income-per-capita-2015, Income per capita 2015
Hints: List each polygon Property to appear in the colored map, followed by a comma, and then its Label to appear in the legend. (Example: pop2010, Population). To show multiple sets, separate each group with a semicolon, but none at the end.

For each Property-Label set listed above, insert dividers to designate specific colors in the legend, separated by commas. You can use numbers (example: 0, 50, 100), which will appear in your legend with dashes (0-50, 50-100, 100+). Or you can use text (example: low, medium, high) if these values appear in your GeoJSON. List ranges to group data for each property in the order listed above. Use either numbers (which will appear with dashes) or text labels (such as low, medium, high). To show mutiple sets, separate each range with a semicolon, but none at end. The number of ranges must equal the number of Property-Label sets listed in the cell above.

Customize: name, State; pop-density-2015, Density per square mile; income-per-capita-2015, Income per capita 2015
Hints: List each Property-Label set to display as pop-up text when the polygon is clicked.
For help, see tutorial in DataVizForAll.org      ------>
Select a ColorBrewer palette to automatically color each Range listed above (and/or select colors manually below).

Leave blank to use the automatic Color Palette above, OR manually insert a color, followed by a comma, for each divider in each Range above. Use either color words (example: lightgray, lightblue, blue) or hex codes (example: #efedf5, #bcbddc, #756bb1). For multiple ranges, separate with a semicolon, but none at the end. The number of colors must match the number of dividers in each range. To use both the automatic ColorBrewer Palette and manual colors, insert blanks (goes to automatic palette above), separated by semicolons.
Insert number between 0 (transparent) and 1 (opaque), or leave blank for default (0.7).
Insert a color word (example: black) or hex code, or leavel blank for default (white).
